solution_line_template: There are {num_families} families of {people_per_family} meaning there are {num_families}*{people_per_family} =<<{num_families}*{people_per_family}={total_people}>>{total_people} people in the vacation rental

They all use {towels_per_person_per_day} oversized beach towel a day so they use {towels_per_person_per_day}*{total_people} = <<{towels_per_person_per_day}*{total_people}={towels_per_day}>>{towels_per_day} towels a day
They use {towels_per_day} towels a day for {num_days} days so in one week they use {towels_per_day}*{num_days} = <<{towels_per_day}*{num_days}={total_towels}>>{total_towels} beach towels

The washing machine can only hold {machine_capacity} towels and they have {total_towels} towels to wash which means there are {total_towels}/{machine_capacity} =<<{total_towels}/{machine_capacity}={loads_of_laundry}>>{loads_of_laundry} loads of laundry
